title: Effects of Concurrent Plant-Based Ketogenic Diet and Intermittent Fasting (Ketoflex 12/3) on the Clinical Progression of Early-to-Mid Stage Alzheimer's Dementia
description_brief: This study investigates the effects of the Ketoflex 12/3 diet on the clinical progression of early-to-mid stage Alzheimer's disease. The study evaluates cognitive function, metabolic changes, and overall health outcomes in participants following the Ketoflex 12/3 dietary protocol.
explanation_target: Reason: The description and trial title indicate a dietary (behavioral) intervention — the Ketoflex 12/3 plant‑based ketogenic diet combined with intermittent fasting — intended to affect clinical progression and cognitive outcomes in early‑to‑mid Alzheimer’s disease. The four provided categories are all drug/intervention types (biologic, small molecule, cognitive‑enhancer drug, or neuropsychiatric symptom drug). A diet is neither a biologic nor a small molecule drug, nor is it a labeled pharmacologic cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric drug, so it does not fit any of those four categories. citeturn0search1turn0search2

Act: Key extracted details and supporting web references: • Intervention: Ketoflex 12/3 (plant‑based mildly ketogenic diet + nightly intermittent fasting). citeturn0search2turn0search6 • Trial registry / design: Interventional, randomized, parallel‑group behavioral intervention (NCT06898424) studying Ketoflex 12/3 vs usual diet with primary cognitive outcome (MMSE) at 6 months; enrollment ~60. citeturn0search1turn0search5 • Purpose/effects studied: cognitive function, metabolic changes, and overall health outcomes (aiming at clinical progression / prevention), not testing a drug molecule or biologic agent. citeturn0search0turn0search1

Reflect: Classification check — because the intervention is a dietary/behavioral protocol (KetoFLEX 12/3 / Bredesen‑style diet) rather than a therapeutic drug or biologic, the trial does not map to any of the four drug‑focused categories. Therefore the correct output is 'N/A'.
